name: Paul Sauer 2004
description:
*'A classic since 1981. '04 has 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, with equal amounts Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Winning aromas cedar, spice, subtle berry, leading to oaky palate a touch lighter, less fruit-substantial than usual, but promising useful development. Vinified traditionally, like all these, in open fermenters. 2 years in French oak.'* - Platter's SA Wine Guide 2008, 4.5☆

 *‘Luscious, full-bodied and sophisticated, this red blend starts with aromas of blackberry, anise and spice, followed by black frit, cedar, mocha and spice flavors. Elegant and complex, with a long, spicy finish.’* - Susan Kostrzewa, Wine Enthusiast, 92/100 (Dec 2009)

 The wines will be cellared at Wine Cellar (Professional wine storage, Cape Town) vintage cellar until maturity (estimated 2028) or withdrawal.
